text: Hey all! I am trying to use a private GitHub package in our react modules but the .npmrc file doesn't seem to get picked up when uploading our project to HubSpot. Does anyone know a workaround for this?

Hello Michiel -

You need to add the contents to a secret with the key of `NPM_RC`

`hs secret add NPM_RC`

And then paste in the contents into the secret.

Then you need to add into `cms-assets.json` or `theme.json` a secrets key; `secretNames` or `secret_names` respectively registering your secret ...

```// theme.json
...
"secret_names": ["NPM_RC"]```
```// cms-assets.json
...
"secretNames": ["NPM_RC"]```
Awesome! That seems to work! Thank you! :smile:

Hi <@U088F7XCX3Q> thanks again for reporting the issue.  Following up to let you know PR has been merged so that next time someone pulls an example it will not have the extra command there in the package JSON <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react/pull/100>

Did you ever find your project after uploading it?

It won't show in the design manager but when you upload it should give a link to the build
^ there's a lot to look at here
also...should I be using cursor? anybody else using it with HubSpot without issues?
Totally up to you. Cursor is widely adopted here at HS. But you donâ€™t need to use it. If you do we are sharing some of our ai prompts and rules that have been helping speed production up
